Key: This is an amusement park...
How is it? Much crazier in real life, right?

Observation. Why are you acting so proud,
Shido?
Leave me alone.

There are many people, and it is very lively.
Everyone is smiling, almost encouraging me
to smile myself.

That's a good thing, Maria. Your smile is sure
to make others smile too. It's contagious.
Make your happiness known to the world.

The more people smile, the more fun it is
for everyone else, right?

Um, I think so... When Shido-san smiles,
I feel... very happy.

I understand what you said, Yoshino. I am
the same.
...Huh? Ah, u-um...
Good grief, Maria-chan. Saying you're the\nsame as Yoshino. Does that mean, with Shido,\nyou also—
Yoshinon!
...? Is something the matter?
No, nothing. Don't worry about it.

(This is how it always goes with Yoshino
and Yoshinon.)

Proposal. Instead of chatting, we should head
to an attraction. In all truth, no amount of time
is adequate when visiting an amusement park.
Yeah, yeah! I agree! Let's get on with it!
All right. Then, where should we go first?

You are right. First... Why not the haunted
house?
...Whaa!

Th-The haunted house, huh? I... I just
remembered something I have to do,
so I'll wait here!
Come on...
Do you not enjoy haunted houses, Kotori?
That's not... true.

Ahh, Maria. Let's forget it. You see, Kotori
hates scary things.

I see. It would be prudent for us to avoid it
then.

It's fine! It's fine, so go ahead! You want
to go, right Maria?

However, with the objective of traveling
as a group...

Maria. Listen to Kotori. In exchange, we'll
be able to go wherever she wants next.
But...

Proposal. I will remain behind as well. We
cannot leave Kotori alone.

Would you be okay with that, Yuzuru?
Is it possible you're not good with
haunted houses either?

Denial. In fact, it is preposterous to suggest
anything could frighten me. On the contrary,
I would not want to be disappointed by it.
I'm not sure I believe you...

Yuzuru, with that attitude, you'll surely miss
out.
Question. Lady Origami, what do you mean?

The essence of a haunted house, sometimes
known as a horror house, is of men and women
being thrown into the dark.
(I don't think that's true in the slightest!)
A dark place... Kind of scary.
I'm picking up what Origami-chan's putting\ndown. It's dark and scary, meaning there's a\nchance to cling onto someone, you know?

Forgetfulness. I hadn't properly trained
myself to recall the romantic potential.
Intriguing argument, Lady Origami.

I feel like you're off base, but... What's the
plan, Yuzuru? Will you come after all?

Refusal. I still intend to speak casually with
Kotori. It might be too early. What do you say
to ice cream, Kotori?

Ooooh! That sounds yummy! You guys have
all the fun you want, Onii-chan.
Thanks, you two. We'll get going, so wait here.
Understood. Leave it to us.

It's even darker than I thought it'd be.
Maria, where are you?

I am here. I see why it is called a haunted
house. They lower both the lighting and
the internal temperature to stage terror.
(Maria looks more curious than scared.)
What about you, Yoshino? You okay?

...Y-Yes! I'm... fine, somehow. But Shido-san,
is it okay if I hold your hand?

Huh, my hand? Yeah, sure. It's dim and
dangerous in here.
All right. Atta girl, Yoshino! Subtly getting\nhim to hold your hand.

I-It's not like that, Yoshinon. This is
because I cannot see well...
Shido. Will you grab my hand as well?
Hm? All right. Here.
Yes. Thank you.

It's hard to walk like this, but oh well.
Let's go.
...Wait.
What's wrong, Origami?

I am frightened too. I want you to hold my
hand.

Wait, Origami. I don't have an open hand.
On top of that, you don't look scared at all.
That's untrue. I am shivering heavily from fear.

G-Gotcha... I mean, it's physically impossible
to hold your hand, you see?
There is a place I can grab aside from your hand.

Gah, hey! Don't grab ahold of my neck!
Pick a sleeve or my back or something, all
right? Just don't grab anything weird.

What do you mean by weird? I do not
understand, so please describe it in detail.
I wouldn't mind an example as well.

Okay, that's enough talking! Come on,
let's go.
(...Sheesh, it's dark in here.)
Kya!
Ooh...
Eeeek!
Everything is staged well...
Whoaaaack!

(Urgh. I didn't think they'd get me a third
time. I let my guard down. I was so shocked
I let go of their hands.)
Sh-Shido?
Shido-san...?
(Um, whose hand should I grab first...?)
Go to Maria.
Go to Yoshino.
Head through the center.
(Maria should be right this way...)
Maria, are you okay?

Yes. I am fine. I was merely startled by
the loud noise.
I see. Then, here.
...Okay.
Then, next is... Heeey, Yoshino?
...Y-Yes!
She sounds close. Yoshino, you there?
Right here...
Oh, that's good. You okay?

Um, I'm sorry... Yoshinon disappeared, so...
I was panicking.
What?! Do you know where she went last?
Ah, um... Origami-san assisted me.
I see. Thanks, Origami.

It is in my nature to support you, Shido.
I always have night-vision goggles on
standby for times like these.
Do you always carry those around?

(Perhaps that was a question better left
unanswered.)
Ah, man. I gotta thank you too. Thanks,\nOrigami-chan. Almost got separated from\nYoshino back there.

(There was a time when Yoshino had
lost Yoshinon and lost control of her
Spirit powers. It was dangerous...)
Really. Thanks, Origami.
...It is nothing.
(I'll head left. Yoshino should be this way.)
Yoshino, are you okay? Hmm?

(Feels like I stepped on something...
What's down here?)
(Hm? This shape...)
This is...! It's Yoshinon! Which must mean...

W-Waaaah, Yoshinon...? Yoshinon, where
are you?

(This is bad! Without Yoshinon with her,
Yoshino is going to panic!)

Calm down, Yoshino! Yoshinon's with me.
Don't move, okay?
Huh...?

Here. It's all right now, Yoshino. Yoshinon's
here. See? Can you tell?

Ahh, Yoshinon... Shido-san... I... I...
I was scared.

(For Yoshino, losing Yoshinon must be
scarier than seeing ghosts.)
Ohh, there there. It's okay.
*sniff*...Yes. Thank you.
...Shido.
Hey, you all right, Maria?
Shido, you... No, never mind.
What's wrong, Maria?
I told you. Never mind.
U-Um, okay. Grab my hand.
Okay.
(Right or left? No. I'll go through the middle.)
Anyone there?
I-I feel something soft. Could this be...?
Shido, are we doing this here?
Origami?!

If you shout, the others will notice, but I do
not mind if you want to be seen, Shido.
Shido-san...?
Shido, what exactly are you doing?

It isn't what it looks like! It was an accident.
That's right. An accident! Nothing more.
Come on. Let's go. Keep going, okay?
Sighting. It looks like they've emerged.

Yeah. It ended up taking a while. Sorry to
keep you waiting.

Denial. No need to apologize. Kotori and I
took our time acquainting ourselves. The
soft serve was delicious too.
Yup, yup! Such soft and creamy soft serve!

I see. Good to hear. Okay, time to go some
place where you two can join.
Proposal. How about that?
The coffee cups, huh? How about we do that?
They really do look like giant coffee cups.

Yeah, that's what they are. You sit inside
the cup and spin it around.

I know of this. However, I am curious as to
why they chose coffee cups as a vessel.

Overseas, they call these teacups, so I'm not
sure. Maybe they wanted to give it an olden
feel?
I see. It makes sense now.
Hey, hey. Shido-kun. Shido-kun.
Hm? What's up, Yoshinon?
Um, Shido-san, um... I...
Just be honest, Yoshino. Yoshino's probably\ngonna get dizzy, so she'll sit this one out.

Ohh. I know how bad dizziness can get.
It was noisy earlier too. Take a breather,
Yoshino. You gonna be okay alone?

Then, I will stay behind this time too. The
four of you can go.
You sure, Origami?
No problem. Besides, it's good to rest.
I'd rather us all go, but okay. We'll hop in.

(As Maria, Kotori, Yuzuru and I sat inside of
a cup, the central mechanism started to spin
slowly as the music played.)

Have you ever ridden on something like
this, Yuzuru?

Recollection. I recall one battle with Kaguya.
We competed to see who could spin the most
until the music stopped.
Ahh. I know what you're talking about.

(As a kid, I always tried spinning it as fast
as I could.)

Regret. After we exited the attraction, our
semicircular canals were too impacted,
leaving us unable to determine who won.
That sounds... troublesome.

Shido, the floor is spinning in time with the
music. Almost like we're dancing.

It's super fun, isn't it? But Maria, what Yuzuru
touched on is true. If you spin the table too
much.
Ah...
This is...
I see. The cup spins as well.

It doesn't look like much at first, but it's a
blast, right?
Yes. A very simple, but well-designed, mechanism.
Th-That's what you're impressed by...
Hee hee. It is fine. Fun as well.
I see. Happy to hear it.
Hey hey, Onii-chan.
I'm getting dizzier...
Oh, sorry. You like it slower.

Welcome back. Pleased to see you enjoyed
yourselves.

Yeah. Thanks for holding down the fort. Now,
next is... Hey, why don't you choose, Origami?

I see. When it comes to amusement parks...
you can't forget that.

Processing. I know what you mean, Lady
Origami. We are done with our warm-up,
yes?

Wait a minute. I'm not following. Where
are we going?
Ohh. You don't get it, Shido-kun? It's\nthat, of course! The roller coaster!

The roller coaster is... apparently...
really popular.
I see.
I am interested as well.

All right. It's decided. Time for the roller
coaster.
